ExpressionParser

Class ExpressionParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • ExpressionParser.ExpressionParser

  • public class ExpressionParser
extends java.lang.Object
    Non-instantiable class which provides methods for parsing an expression to a tree.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static Node currentNode
      Variable which is modified when parsing variable names or constant.
      private static int expressionLength
      Variable which holds the length of the given expression for a single expressionToTree() call.
      private static java.util.Stack<Node> operandStack
      Operand stack which will contain leaves and/or operator with leaves attached.
      private static java.util.Stack<Operator> operatorStack
      Operator stack which will hold only operators.
      private static boolean unaryCheck
      Flag variable which is true after encountering an operator.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      private ExpressionParser()
      Dummy constructor to prevent instantiating.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private static Node createOperationNode()
      Pops operator stack and two (or one if unary) operands from the operand stack which will be attached as leaves.

    • Field Detail

      • expressionLength

        private static int expressionLength
        Variable which holds the length of the given expression for a single expressionToTree() call.

      • currentNode

        private static Node currentNode
        Variable which is modified when parsing variable names or constant. Those methods return the new position, and modify this variable as a side-effect.

      • unaryCheck

        private static boolean unaryCheck
        Flag variable which is true after encountering an operator. Makes it easier to check if a new '+' or '-' variable is unary or binary.

      • operandStack

        private static final java.util.Stack<Node> operandStack
        Operand stack which will contain leaves and/or operator with leaves attached. Is always emptied after parsing in order to be ready for next call.

      • operatorStack

        private static final java.util.Stack<Operator> operatorStack
        Operator stack which will hold only operators. Is always emptied after parsing in order to be ready for next call.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ExpressionParser

        private ExpressionParser()
        Dummy constructor to prevent instantiating.

    • Method Detail

      • expressionToTree

        public static ExpressionTree expressionToTree(java.lang.String expression,
                                              int lineNumber)
        Build a tree from an expression. Uses two stacks (operand and operator).
        Parameters:
        expression - string as it is read from file
        lineNumber - line number used in tree for various output messages
        Returns:
        tree for given expression

      • createOperationNode

        private static Node createOperationNode()
        Pops operator stack and two (or one if unary) operands from the operand stack which will be attached as leaves.
        Returns:
        operator node with leaves

      • isLetter

        private static boolean isLetter(char c)
        Checks if character is letter
        Parameters:
        c - input character
        Returns:
        true if letter

      • isDigit

        private static boolean isDigit(char c)
        Checks if character is digit
        Parameters:
        c - input character
        Returns:
        true if digit

      • parseVariable

        private static int parseVariable(java.lang.String expression,
                                 int offset)
        Parses a variable named and creates it's node. A variable can be any sequence of alphanumerical characters starting with a letter.
        Parameters:
        expression - input expression
        offset - starting position
        Returns:
        the index that is reached after parsing variable name

      • parseConstant

        private static int parseConstant(java.lang.String expression,
                                 int offset)
        Parses a constant value and creates it's node
        Parameters:
        expression - input expression
        offset - staring position
        Returns:
        the index that is reached after parsing constant value
